item.description:
No Honor Among Thieves is a competitive/cooperative game for three to six players, in which each player assembles a crew of thieves and sets out to see who can steal the most from the rich and powerful of the kingdom.

Each player is the head of their own crew, which consists of different character cards recruited from an array of thieves available for hire. These characters are then sent on heists to try and overcome defense cards in front of objectives, using their different sets of skills to bypass guards, traps and walls to get to the filthy lucre that they're after. Players not involved in the heist will, of course, try and stop the thieves in their tracks by playing Scheme cards, which represent the quirks of fate which might cause a heist to fail--unexpectedly alert guards, City Watch patrols, or the simple mistake that leads to disaster.

Staging a heist alone is difficult, but working together with other players leaves you open to betrayal by your so-called allies, or gives you the chance to betray them, and take it all for yourself. Once any player has been betrayed, the game changes, and more dangerous abilities on different cards can now be played. The Assassin begins killing other characters, the Pickpocket starts stealing from players, the Fall Guy takes the blame, and the whole table becomes a little more vicious. Thieves like to believe they have a code of honor, but once that illusion is broken, there is no going back.

What will you risk to be the richest and cleverest thief in this city of rogues?

item.description:
In this party game, players are all tourists, or strangers in a strange land. They come across signs, and must decipher their meaning. Players are dealt three Sign cards, and at the start of each turn, a Where card is drawn (depicting a location). Each turn, one player will act as the Tour Guide, and choose a Sign card to play with the Where card. All other players write a Caption for the Sign based on the Where. The Tour Guide collects all of the Captions, and after reading all of them aloud, will select the "best" one.
Captions are funny, outrageous, completely irreverent, or an earnest attempt to give the sign appropriate meaning. 
Each time a Tour Guide picks your Caption, you win a Sign card. The first player to get 5 cards wins!

item.description:
The Mystigo Game Kit is a party pack designed to be played by any group of people easily at any social occasion. The games are all extremely fast and easy to learn and teach, while at the same time being strategical enough to enjoy time and again. The Kit includes four stand alone card games diverse in themes and tactics, so there's a game to appeal to any group. Do you want to build the world's greatest art collection, or create strange creatures in a crazy genetics lab? Perhaps you prefer to throw a cow into a tornado or send drunken dwarves down the mine to fetch you glittering gemstones? Make your choice, teach the game in moments, and play!

The Mystigo Games Kit includes:

The Gallerist: Bid against other players to acquire the best collection at the most expensive art auction of the century.

60 Dwarves: The race is on to hire the best dwarves and send them into the treacherous mine for valuable gems.

Trust Me!: A classic European bluff-tastic card game is made more colorful and crazy, with new mechanics and cards introduced into the mix.

Dr Blender's Lab: Dr Blender has mixed up the body parts of the strange creatures in his genetics lab, and it's up to you to put them back together.

Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War is a collectible dice-building tabletop game designed by Quarriors! creators Michael Elliott and Eric M. Lang.

WizKids has announced a Civil War set for its popular Marvel Dice Masters Collectible Dice Game. Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War will include Starter Sets, Foil Packs, a Team Box, a Collector’s Box, a Playmat, and a Dice Bag. Release is planned for May.

Based on the Marvel comic book Civil War storyline, the set will include iconic characters from both sides of the conflict, like Spider-Man, Captain America, and Iron Man. It will also introduce new mechanics for the game: Thunderbolts, Enlistment, and New Warriors.

item.description: Each player plays with one or two cars. Movement is determined with a die (3, 4, 5) and a color die (red, yellow, green). The two playing boards fit together to form a large City map. The players have to visit the spaces listed on the card or cards of their color. The first player to reach his final destination wins the game.

Summary:

Neo-Hunt 2 is a round-based board and card game for 3-6 players. Each player controls a single "varan" (a bio-engineered humanoid reptile). The goal of the game is to kill other players' "varan" and to eliminate "trooper" units (game tokens). Play continues until only one "varan" remains or until all "trooper" units are destroyed. If multiple "varan" units remain then scores are tallied to determine the winner.

Setup:

The game board is randomly created by assembling it from hexagonal sector tiles. Players are given one random "varan" card and one "trooper" card; "varan" units are initially deployed in a hidden state. "Trooper" units are then places sequentially on the board. Players then draw a full hand of action cards and play begins.

Game Play:

Play proceeds in "rounds" during which each player gets a turn. Each player's "varan" can make an attack upon a unit it can see, either "varan" or "trooper". Successful attacks deal damage (which may be insufficient to remove a unit). Destroyed units are removed and scored. Players also draw special cards and may play them, taking whatever action is described. After the players have moved all "trooper" units then move or fire at visible "varan" units following a basic rule.

User Comments:

The game is print-and-play and published for free access via HTML. Components and rules are downloadable in PDF format. Color printing is recommended.

Summary:

Neo-Hunt is a board game about highly advanced cyber varans (large humanoid reptilians) in special testing zone or battleground. Their mission is simple: destroy as many trooper units or other varans as possible before being destroyed or until there are no more troopers left

Setup:

Players select a "varan" token and a corresponding "order" card. All the "order" cards for players are combined with one gray "trooper" order card; this deck is shuffled to determine phase order. "Trooper" cards are randomly selected to make a trooper deck; 7-17 cards may be used (this will determine approximate game length). "Sector Tiles" are then shuffled and randomly distributed into a circle form to create a random playing board. Players then receive a random "varan" card and eleven "action" cards.

Game Play:

Play continues until all "troopers" are destroyed. If a player's "varan" is destroyed they can resume with new "varan" but will suffer a score penalty. On each player's turn they utilize action cards and move their varan into a new sector or attack any other unit they see. On the trooper turn standard rules apply to move or shoot; troopers will only shoot at visible varans. The game supports a few special status conditions which may occur.

User Comments:

The game is print-and-play and published for free access via HTML. Components and rules are downloadable in PDF format. Color printing is recommended.

The Epic Geek edition was intended to celebrate the 10th anniversary of Wits & Wagers, but it needed another year to get "that extra kick over the cliff" (yes, this version goes to 11). There are 3 things which make the Epic Geek edition different (and better) than every other edition of Wits & Wagers:

1) It has all new questions about the epic stories we love such as Star Wars, The Avengers, Lord of the Rings, Harry Potter, The Matrix, Monty Python, Batman, etc. If there is a brand you love, chances are you'll find a question or two about it in this game.

2) It has stunning artwork on the back of each HUGE 5" x 8" player board. These illustrations were commissioned by some of the best artists in the industry such as Boris Vallejo & Julie Bell, Jimmy Palmiotti & Amanda Connor , and Jon Kovalic.

3) Every player board comes with an unique in-game power that adds a layer of fun interaction to the game. Anytime the zombie player goes all-in and loses, he comes back to life with 5 free chips. The Wizard of Odds can switch any two payout odds before the answers are revealed. The Superhero helps the downtrodden by moving another player's bet to the correct answer (for which he receives a small token of gratitude from the mayor). You get the idea! It’s the interaction of these thematic in-game powers that make this edition epically fun to play.

Megalomania is a card-centric base-building game in which players take the role of megalomaniacs. The flavor of the game is a mixture of James Bond and Looney Tunes villains, focusing on ridiculous scheming rather than sinister.

Game-play is accomplished in turns, with each player possessing two actions. Players may build structures, hire minions, develop schemes and attack other players. Most cards synergize with others, granting bonuses for building intelligently and towards particular strategies.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to score twelve infamy. Infamy is generated by completing plots - which require resources - and assaults - which require greater attack than an opponent has defense.

Each turn in Vikings Gone Wild — a deck-building, resource management game based on the online real-time strategy game — players can either buy permanent buildings sitting in front of them (resource factories, resources containers, etc) or buy units, towers and special cards that improve their deck and offense/defense capacity.

The only way to win is by successfully attacking each other, and each attack involves interesting bluffing mechanisms in which the attacker doesn't know the defense capacity of their opponent...

item.description:
A fast-paced easy to learn card game where you grab everyone else's candy before they get yours.
Get ready for Candy Grab. It’s easy to play, fun for everyone, and totally addictive! Be the last player with any candy cards left in your candy pile by grabbing and eating the other players' candy. Watch out! The other players may make you eat your own candy instead! It is a great family game with plenty of opportunities for any player to go from no candy, to lots of candy in a single hand. When it comes to a fun game for the whole family, Candy Grab is a must have game that provides hours of entertainment for all!

item.description:
The game uses a pack of 81 cards consisting of one Super HOO HA! card, 24 red "answer" cards and 4 suits each of 14 cards of a particular colour. Each suit consists of one HOO, one HA! and 12 "question" cards of the form "40+8"and "2x8". 
 Seven cards are dealt to each player, one is turned face up and the rest put face down as a draw deck.
 On their turn a player should can do one of five things depending on the top card of the discard pile.
 1) Play another question card of the same colour as the top card
 2) Play a question card that has the same answer 
 3) Play correct answer
 4) Play a question card that matches the answer
 5) Play any HOO HA! or Super HOO HA! card
 If they can do none of these they pass.
 Each of the above plays has an effect, e.g. next player misses their turn.
 When one player gets rid of all their cards the rest of the players add up the values of their unplayed cards and a running total is kept. The winner is the last player to reach 215.
 The Super HOO HA! game consists of three 81 card packs, based on the numbrs 8, 12 and 14 respectively and only one pack is used in any one game.

A battle is brewing between the undisputed king of the cryptids Bigfoot and his stone cold cousin the Yeti, who is sick of playing second fiddle.

In Bigfoot vs. Yeti, you are an up and coming cryptozoologist mounting expeditions in the hopes of proving the existence of unknown creatures such as Bigfoot, Yeti, The Loch Ness Monster, the Jersey Devil or Extraterrestrials. Your ultimate goal is to gain fame and fortune by being the first cryptozoologist credited with the actual discovery of a new species, making you world famous. Somehow you have landed yourself smack dab in the middle of feud between Bigfoot and Yeti so it's time to choose your side as it will help shape the fate of your research and ultimately your success!

During each turn in the game, players draw from either the Unknown (deck) or from the top of Tabloids (discard pile). Each player mounts or joins expeditions for the various cryptids in the hope of reaching ten or more points in play. If ten or greater points is achieved that expedition would be considered to have found enough proof for science to take notice, thereby doubling that expedition's score. Also during each turn a single Action card may be played which can do things like strengthen the value of an expedition in play, retrieve cards from the Tabloids or manipulate other facets of the game. Each cryptid has an ability that will help you in some way and is triggered when you play them. At the end of a round, cards in the Tabloids that match expeditions in play discredit that expedition. The game also has a shutout rule involving Extraterrestrials that, if achieved, prevents all other players from scoring that round.

item.description:
In All Tricks, No Treats you and your friends, brothers and sisters plus that one annoying neighborhood kid that always tags along have just finished divvying all of the good candy and you are down to those last terrible "treats". Stuff like pretzels, toothbrushes, stale candy corn and the dreaded rock. You want to get as little of that junk as possible!

All Tricks, No Treats is an abstract card laying game for two to four weary trick or treaters. Players take turns placing "treats" cards in a way to minimize the crappy "treats" they will get stuck with which is determined by one of the cards they have selected from their hands and not placed.

Masters of the Tourist Trophy is a motorcycle racing sports replay game simulating the Isle of Man Tourist Trophy. The Isle of Man TT has, for many years, been regarded as the most prestigious and oldest motorcycle race in the world... and also the most dangerous motorcycle road-race in the world!

Summary

The game is typical of Lambourne's sports replay simulations in that it takes place on tables and charts (no board or counters) with minimal player decisions required.

The simulation has been developed to capture the confused progress of the Isle of Man mountain bike races. With drivers setting off at different times, the system is able to record both the positions on the course from a spectator viewpoint as well as keep track of the actual driver times for determining a race winner. As in the actual Tourist Trophy, crashes and mishaps are common and not all riders can be expected to finish.

The game includes race control sheets for six different classes of race, from the ultra-lightweight 125cc bikes to the Formula One 1200cc monsters. The famous TT sidecars are also represented in a class of their own.

The drivers represented and rated are drawn from the "all-time greats" from over 100 years of Tourist Trophy events.

Brief outline of the Game System

The race is set up on a Race Control Sheet that lists Driver Name, Driver Rating and Start Time. For each stage of the race every driver rolls two pairs of dice (red and green) to advance their progress.

The difference between the green "+" and red "-" dice, when added to the driver performance rating, determine whether the driver performance improves or degrades on each stage of the lap. Comparison of the driver performance ratings will reveal the order of the drivers on the circuit as they pass each checkpoint on the circuit.

Rolling doubles on either pair of dice may improve or degrade the driver performance rating, but rolling double "6" requires a further roll on Rider Mistakes or Mechanical Trouble charts. Such problems usually result in a performance loss, but can also cause retirement through a crash or serious mechanical failure. Game charts will determine the precise location of each such accident on the circuit.

Drivers must also elect to Pit Stop at least once during the race. This can be dome at a time decided by the player and requires a die roll and chart reference to determine the effect the pit stop has on race time.

At the end of the lap the cumulative performance for each of the four lap stages can be cross-referenced against the game charts to determine the lap time and average speed for each driver on the circuit.

A tile laying game with 62 cards.

Every card has 4 squares on it. Squares come in four colors.

Winner is the player who covers the smallest area laying out the cards delt to him on top of each other using matching color patterns.

Part of the Ravensburger Compact Serie

link.value: Koffer zu und ab die Reise

item.description:
Conn8 is a 2-player abstract strategy game. The aim for each player is to connect their own colored sides on a board paved with octagons and squares.

On their turn players place:

 one piece in an octagon, or
 two pieces on two different squares.




On their first turn, the first player may only place a single piece in a square. After that, the normal rules apply.

item.description:
Rio de Janeiro, 1868. Quissama is a fugitive slave from guaiamum malta who counts on English detective Woodruff to help him find Bernardina, his missing mother. At the same time, he needs to run from Alemão and his malta, who wants to capture him. Araújo wants to make his business prosper, but Alencar is eyeing the political influence. In the court, the Princess wants to set slaves freed, while the Emperor uses his power as he pleases. In the squares, you will face the capoeira fighting between Nagoas and Guaiamuns, which divide the Rio de Janeiro at the time. Choose your characters and take part in this plot!

How to play
Draw, combine and use your cards to establish your territory in Rio de Janeiro, 1868. Place your meeples and prosper thanks to coins that will help open trades, free slaves and employ capoeiras. With some card combinations, get the right to choose a character. Use your skills and reach your goal to win the match. But be careful with your opponents! They can cause malta attacks against your territory, deploy your ministers or steal the characters you worked hard to win. Go through all scandals and the power of money and be the first to reach one of your characters' goal!

item.description:
From Yaah! magazine #4 published by Flying Pig Games:

Poland Strikes! is a standalone module in the Sticks and Stones series. The first entry, published by Flying Pig's sister company Tiny Battle Publishing, saw Soviets and Yankees fighting over precious land in Germany in post-nuclear 1987. While the USSR is distracted by all of this, Poland decides to settle the score with Hungary after years of escalating tensions along the border. With three scenarios and 88 counters gorgeously illustrated by wunderkind Christian Sperling (Neuschwabenland), it's a cold-war-goes-hot tactical combat game by the undisputed master of the genre.

From the back of the box:

Join the stars of Cars 2 in 4 cool card games!

• Race to spot pics and get rid of your cards.
• Speed through the alphabet to find pics.
• Test your memory with a matching game.
• Combine cards to complete missions.

Start your engines! It's time for Pictureka Cars 2!

Four games included:
8-Away
Alphabetti
Matchureka
Pass the Pics

From back of the box:
Each player is a dealer in new and used cars. Players compete with each other to make car sales. There is a lot of friendly Wheeling and Dealing as players try to earn enough money to buy the Ultimate Car.

A roll and move game where players aim to earn enough money to purchase a BMW and have it complete a lap of lap of the board. The includes opportunities to interfere with trades and sales other players are attempting to make. This represents the car traders competing to get a sale by offering a discount.

A fascinating educational game that tells you all about the ecology and life history of our extraordinary Australian frogs (description from the back of the game board)

The game is a roll and move. On about every third space there are instructions to follow (eg "Hot weather. Have a rest. Miss a turn.", "Jump for joy. You have found a mate already. Advance to 'Egg-laying lilypad.'", "DANGER You are eaten by a yabbie. Return to start.").

Sometimes the instructions are to take a "Tadpole" or a "Frog" card. These cards have a similar range of penalties and benefits as the board spaces with instructions. The frog cards are much larger than the tadpole cards, in full colour and include some factual information about frogs on them. A couple require the player to imitate a frog's call (described on the card) to receive the benefit.

There are two places where players get a choice of paths but other than that there is no choice in movement.

Party quiz game about (mainly) pop stars. Each of the 55 large format (11.5 x 8 cm) cards gives five facts about a particular pop star. A player rolls a dice and is read the clue that corresponds to the number rolled. If they correctly identify the pop star, they win the card. The sixth fact on each card is the name of the pop star, so if they roll a 6 they automatically win the card. The game is won by the first player to win 5 cards. There are 9 special power cards that allow, for example, an extra clue or the opportunity to 'steal' a card. These are kept by the 'reader' who picks them up.

name.value: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in the Baths

item.description:
Who Killed Devius Taxus?

The year is 50 AD and the place is Ancient Rome. The last few days have seen the best Roman athletes, chariot racers and gladiators entertaining the vast crowds in the Colosseum and Circus Maximus. The Thermal Baths in Rome will be the venue for a lavish feast at which the cream of Rome's political and sporting societies will bathe and then feast. However, before the feast has begun Senator Devius Taxus is found dead in the plunge pool. Host your own party to discover how he came to meet such a steamy end.

Zogar's Gaze (2nd Edition) takes what worked well in the original version and adds new mechanics to improve the gaming experience for all!

Players take turns going to the market to buy items to equip their heroes with. Then they delve into dungeon one card at a time. Death is around every corner, but so is fame and fortune. How deep will you go on your turn? Will you risk it all for a possible pile of gold? Zogar, the evil wizard, is also watching over your every move. Attract too much attention and he will reveal himself, ending your turn, and possibly the game!

One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'TV'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about TV. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

SHOOTERZ Hockey Card Game is fast-paced, head-2-head fun! 
Players pick through a special deck looking for combinations to shoot for a goal, while trying to keep their players out of the sin bin. Big goals and big saves!
 There are two teams, red vs. blue. The jerseys are centres, wingers and defence. Your team must collect one of each position to shoot for a goal. However, your opponent might be able to block the shot if his/her team jerseys have a higher total number. There are special shooting and goalie cards for each shot. Do you know your opponent's tendencies?

Each time through the deck is a full period, with OT and shootout rules. GAME ON!

item.description:
This is a card game, a variation of the English game Pairs (known as Memo or Memory in Europe) but has unique twists on that type of game. The game was given away in Quality Street boxes of chocolates in 2005.

Object of the game: To finish with property worth more than any other player.

The playing cards are placed at random face down on the table. Each player should also start the game with 7 Quality Street sweets!

Starting with the youngest, the players turn over two cards. If the property on the two cards is identical, the player keeps the cards and turns over two others. When two cards which do not match are revealed, they are turned over face down again, and the player’s turn is over.

Hidden in the playing cards are a number of ‘Community Chest’ and ‘Chance’ cards. If revealed, the player accepts their reward or fine, and if it is the first card turned over, that player still turns over a second card as part of their turn. These cards are removed from the table once revealed.

There is one ‘Go to Jail’ card. If this is revealed that player’s turn is over (even if it is the first card turned), and they must miss their next turn. Unlike the Chance and Community Chest cards, this card stays on the table, so you are wise to remember where it is!

The cards have a value on them (related to real values on a traditional English Monopoly board). So it is not the one with the most cards who wins, it is the one with the highest value of cards that wins.

A fun and simple geo-themed game, where players put their tokens on a map, trying to be the nearest from the monument shown on the card. But beware, i bet you're not on the good place !

First, players draw a card from a pile, that displays a monument, a famous building, or anything else related to a specific place, sometimes accompanied by a flag.

The players should guess where in Europe this place is. The first player put his meeple where he think the answer is, on the European map/board. The next player take his turn and must do the same.

When all players have placed their markers, the card is turned over, revealing the right position. Now, using the benchmarks along the edges of the map, the players should deduct how far they are distant from the solution. The nearest player from this place score more points. If 2 or more player's markers are on the same position, the token that is under the others scores more points.

Then a new card is revealed. Game ends after 12 cards revealed.

In a distant land covered in lush forests and bordered by hills and mountains, magicians battle mercilessly on the plains of Thärin. The end goal: to defeat all adversaries and become the Northland continent's most legendary magician.

Dark Mages is a 120-card game that can be played by 2 to 8 players. It is a game of both luck and strategy that can last anywhere from 20 to 60 minutes.

This game contains 8 character cards, 112 playing cards, rules and instructions, 7 polyhedron dice (d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20 and d00), and a velvet pouch.

item.description:
Mini version of Schnappt Hubi!

The cheeky ghost Hubi has pilfered the treats of the animals! Together, they pursue him through the haunted house. Can they catch him before midnight.

Crazy Heroes is a game where players have to collect heroes and criatures to make the greatest team.

Each character gives the player a type of dice, that can use in the future combats.

Collect gold from your heroes and use it to buy more, or fight against creature to capture it and join it to your team. Get a team of 10 heroes (or creatures) to win the game.

It's Kelly's Birthday, but the presents have gotten all mixed up! Help Kelly match the presents to the friends who brought them. This game is part Memory and part set matching.

Includes 20 Friends Cards with the matching present shown in the corner; 20 Gifts for Kelly: 4 yellow stars, 4 pink hearts, 4 blue flowers and 4 purple squares with different gifts inside; 2 Kelly Cards; and instruction sheet.

Cards are dealt out evenly to players. If a player is dealt a Kelly card, she places it face up beside her and is dealt another card so that each player has the same number of Friends Cards.

The presents are turned upside down in the center. Players take turns turning over a present to see if it matches the present on one of the Friends cards she holds. If it does, she shows it to everyone along with the card and sets the two aside. If it does not, she shows the other players what is inside the present and turns it back over. If a player has a Kelly card, she can use it to turn over all the presents of one shape until she finds the present she is looking for. The Kelly card is then turned over and cannot be used again. The winner is the first to find all the presents matching their Friends cards.

A second way to play is to turn the presents upside down in the center and put the rest of the cards in a draw pile. Player turns one card over and tries to find the matching present. If the present matches the player takes the Friends card & present and sets them aside and turns over the next card. If the present does not match, the next player gets to turn over a present and try to match the card, continuing until a player matches the present to the card. If a Kelly card is turned over, the player turns the next Friends card over and uses the Kelly card to help her turn over the presents until she finds a match. Winner is the player with the most matches.

Monster Allegiance is a strategic fast-paced card game which challenges 2-4 players to compete for majority control over a horde of powerful and often unpredictable monsters. Tilt the balance of power in your favor and hold it until the end of the game, and you win! But beware... These are not mindless minions, but proud and dangerous creatures. Defeat an opponent’s monster, and you’ll earn it’s allegiance. But if one falls to your opponent… you’ll lose its respect and it’ll turn against you! As a Monster Commander, you must strategically decide when and where to place each monster, how to capitalize on the elemental strengths and weaknesses of each, and how to turn the tide with powerful item and element cards. Enter the Monster’s arena, but keep your mind sharp…. for if it dulls, your usefulness to the monsters will swiftly end...

-From Kickstarter description

Features:
-Beautiful colorful pixel art monsters.
-Simple but streategic battles- decided by number comparisons on 4 sides. 
-Playable with competitive personal decks or a single deck for balanced play
-Unique twist - All monsters brought into play by either player can swap teams. 
-Durable card material
-Multiple games to play - new game instructions released regularly. 
-Future expansions with guaranteed content - No random boosters required to obtain all cards.

name.value: Rainbow Brite: A Color Matching Game

item.description:
Players spin & move around the board, collecting different color sprinkles and trying to fill their rainbow card with each color. Beware of Murky Dismall, who will take your sprinkles away. The first player to fill his rainbow card with color sprinkles, wins the game!

Comes with 4 Tokens, Spinner, 24 Color Sprinkles, 4 Rainbow Cards, Gameboard & Instruction Sheet.

Publisher's summary:

å¿ã‚¸ãƒ£ãƒ³!! (Ninjan!!) is a children's card game from ã•ã¨ãƒ¼ãµãã¿ã‚Šã‚ (Sato Familie). "This game is a fighting game between ninja. Young children can play this game. It is possible to rise quickly." The game is for two players.

The time is the Sengoku (Warring States) period. While Busho military commanders engage in fierce battles on history's center stage, ninjas risk their lives for their commanders. When two ninjas meet, one of them must die, because whoever discovers their identify shall not stay alive.

This is a one-on-one ninja battle game. The player on the offense plays Attack cards from his hand. The player on the defense guards against the attack with his cards. The player who manages to exhaust his opponent's Strength deck wins the game.

link.value: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

item.description:
"It is known that from time to time Orcs perform races with steam cars, aka "Goratank Racing". Racers, riding pimped machines, run till death on a crazy race. The winner gets a championship title, a special "Trophy-Gun", fame and money. This competition is also known as "Orcorrida" (SpeedOrc)." - Lyzarbhi Chronicles

Orcorrida is a card game where you´re an Orc on a deadly race that takes place at the Fields of Gore World. Prove your courage and driving skills on a competition where anything goes. During the race, Orcs release all their wildness and skills with killing machines in an exciting competition on tracks through Orc Island.

It's a 3-6 player game where laughthing and fun is guaranteed.

Game Components: 54 cards and 1 "pole position" token

Game comes in 3 languages: Portuguese, English and Orcish

You're an orc racer and you have to play "road cards" to create your "path for victory". You start with 5 cards and use one of them at a time to make an action. You may have an "Orcrook" card to difficult the race: missiles, mines, bump actions or turbo to increase car speed are some of the tricks you can use against the other players.
"Road cards" have point values and you must play them to run for victory. The player with the biggest number of points is the Champion of this crazy race.

name.value: ヘンゼルかグレーテル: Hansel or Gretel

item.description:
The animals have escaped from the zoo, and it's up to the zookeepers to get everyone back in their cages — but lots of things can happen while you're chasing critters...

In Zooscape, originally released as Curio Collectors (ã¯ã‚“ã‹é€šéª¨è‘£å¸‚), you must prove yourself the best zookeeper by rounding up animals worth the most points, but remember that all the animals need enough space in their cage to stay happy! Shove too many in one cage, and they'll be worth almost nothing to you.

In each round, someone deals a line of twelve cards face up on the table; each card depicts an animal (a curio in the original version) along with a point value and a limit. The starting player splits the line in two by choosing a dividing point. Each player holds two cards showing the left or right group, and each player chooses, then simultaneously reveals which group of cards they want. If only one player chooses a side, they take all the cards in that group and add them to their personal tableau. If a side is chosen by more than one player, however, then one of the players who chose it splits that group into two smaller groups, then everyone who originally chose this group secretly votes again for which group they want. This process repeats with each group until either each player has taken some number of cards or groups have been reduced to single cards and two or more players are still voting to take them; in this case, those single cards are placed in a special pile. At the start of a round, the starting player adds a special card to the line-up and whoever wins this card collects all of the animals in this special pile.

Players complete three rounds this way, then score points. If a group of cards has exceeded the limit on it — say, by collecting four cards when the limit is three — then the owner of these cards scores only 1 point per card instead of the point value for each card. Some cards in the game allow you to remove cards from your collection, possibly allowing you to stay under the limit and score more points. You might also start trying not to win cards so as not to spoil the value of what you've already collected. (In Curio Collectors, you would effectively crash the market value for an item by trying to sell too many of them at one time.) Whoever has the most points wins!

Zooscape has also been published as Kimono, with players collecting Japan-related collectibles and cultural objects.

item.description:
From Mancala World:

Alemungula is a mancala game played by the Wetawit (formerly spelled Wetaweat) in Ethiopia, around the towns of Asosa and Beni Sangul, towards the Sudan border. Wetawit is an ethnic group in Ethiopia and Sudan. They speak Berta, a Nilo-Saharan language. The population of this group is about 248,000.

The game is played mainly by youngsters, though sometimes also by adults in their leisure time. It is closely related to Um el Bagara ("the cow game") which is played by the Baggara in northern Sudan. However, Alemungula offers bigger challenges because singletons may also be moved.

Alemungula was first described by the ethiopist Richard Pankhurst in 1971. The game was implemented by Arty Sandler for online play at igGameCenter on December 19, 2010.

Rules

Alemungula is played on a wooden board which consists of 2x5=10 holes known as tisiya alemungula ("alemungula wood"), while the holes are called ful alemungula. Play is begun with five stones in each hole.

At his turn, a player picks up all the contents of one of his holes and then distributes, one by one, the stones into the following holes, the direction depending on the hole chosen. Moves from either of a player's two left-hand holes are made in clockwise direction, moves from either of the player's two right-hand holes are made in an anti-clockwise direction, and moves from the center hole may be made in either direction. The move is finished after a single lap.

A singleton which is played into an empty hole of the opponent's side, that is either the last or the first hole of the opponent's row), may not be played back in the next move.

If the last stone is dropped in one of the opponent's holes and makes a two or a four, these stones are captured. Should one or more of the opponent's holes immediately preceding this on the line of play, also have been increased to two or four stones these will likewise be captured.

The captured stones are removed from the board and stored.

The game ends when a player has no legal move. Each player then captures the stones remaining on his side.

The winner is the player who captured the greater number of stones during the game. If both players captured the same number the game is a draw.

item.description: Can you stand on your shoulders or hold a steady stance like a warrior? Increase flexibility and focus as you practice 48 yoga poses in this fun and simple card game. Your goal in Yoga Cards: Be the first player to correctly hold seven yoga poses that meet your mission and you win!

Your Goal: Collect the most pairs of matching Yoga Pose Tiles.

Beginner (Ages 3 and up)
Learn yoga poses as you search for matching pairs. Find the most matching pairs and - YOU WIN!

Advanced (Ages 6 and up)
After you find a matching pair, perform the illustrated yoga pose. Correctly perform the most yoga poses and - YOU WIN!

name.value: Blood Before Richmond: Glendale & White Oak Swamp

item.description:
The second title in the Blood Before Richmond series recreates the Battle of Glendale, and its artillery-only side-show, White Oak Swamp.

The Union host is heading for Malvern Hill, a superior defensive position that will allow them to escape destruction and encirclement. If Lee wants to achieve those aims, he needs to cut off that retreat at a place called Glendale, which requires the careful coordination of his generals. But, par for the course, only A.P. Hill and Longstreet seem capable of doing what they’re told: Ben Huger and his men are too busy moonlighting as lumberjacks, while Stonewall Jackson fights a pointless artillery duel at White Oak Swamp - when he’s not napping, anyway. Difficult terrain and fresh, high-quality Union brigades mean that the weary Confederates have their work cut out for them. The optional Galena Rule gives the Union command-control problems of their own to contend with.

Like other titles in the series, a modified 2d6 die roll determines which Confederate divisions activate on a given turn. Divisions that didn't pull there weight are less likely to show up than those that did most of the fighting. It's a simple, clever, and elegant way to recreate the difficulties that Lee had during the Seven Days.

Blood Before Richmond builds on the same "stacks of steps" combat system introduced in Tom Russell's Blood on the Alma (2012). Flipping a counter over when you take a hit just doesn't capture the feel of bloody infantry collisions or the horrifying impact of artillery fire. This system uses step counters stacked beneath an identifying counter to account for brutal attrition and devastating wipe-outs.

link.value: Blood Before Richmond: Battles of the Seven Days

item.description:
From the publisher:

The Isle of Coconuts is a beautiful place with lush palm trees and teams of Monkeys jumping from tree to tree competing for delicious coconuts. Roll the dice and count your chances to become the biggest team on the palm tree or be smart enough to stay away - either way, you win coconuts. Let your team be the first to gather 10 coconut tokens to win the game.

What They'll Learn

Quick Addition - Each turn, players add up the dice one of three ways to decide where to place Monkeys on palm tree fronds.

Risk vs. Reward - Players pick the palm trees where they can build the biggest team of Monkeys. Stay away from trees where there could be an all-way tie or where you might end up being the smallest team when all the palm tree fronds are full.

name.value: モリヤウォーズ (Moriya Wars: Episode II)

item.description: ãƒ¢ãƒªãƒ¤ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚º (Moriya Wars: Episode II) is a hidden identity game in which each player has different victory conditions. To keep it from being too easy to determine who is which character based on what you do in the game, players need to select actions based on the dice rolled in the game, so feel free to blame the dice when you "have" to do something that seems like it's leading someone toward victory.

In JunkWars 3020, the players fight for the control of the battlefield. Holding Objectives and enemy Bases the player raises victory points, when he reaches 12 the game is won.

Each player controls one of the four faction of the game, which is composed by 4 characters, 3 power cards and a deck of 36 battle cards.

In each turn the player must assign to his characters unit tokens, which are divided in infantry, artillery and gears. The different combination of unit tokens enable the character to perform different attacks, activating battlecards. In this way the player can defeat enemy characters and gain control of the field.

The Buildings uses the gameplay found in Sky Scrapers, but creates new goals for new playing areas.

In each game, you start with pieces of the two players on the game board. Each turn, a player moves one of their own stacks a number of spaces equal to the height of the stack, stacking it onto of another stack. A stack is owned by the player whose piece is on top.

In the original Sky Scrapers game, included in this set, whoever has the most stacks that contain at least four pieces wins the game. A different game board crowns the player who has created the tallest stack. A third game board gives the win to whoever controls more of the six inner spaces on the game board.

Moon-Sun-Angel includes sixteen cubes, eight each in two colors, with each cube featuring the moon, sun and angel on three sides and having blank faces on the other three. Players takes turns placing one cube in the playing area, either on the game board or on another cube.

If a player can create a row of four cubes that feature the same symbol or color, that player wins. Alternately, a player can create two rows of three cubes to win.

After a successful launch at the Tokyo Game Market in November 2015, a new edition was produced in January 2016 under the name e-SOLO-e (çµµæƒ), which is a Japanese word that means "match symbols". Three editions were produced, Spiritual (a copy of the original Moon-Sun_Angel edition), Japanesque (å’Œé¢¨çµµæƒ), and Cat World (Nekoten ã­ã“ã®å¤©ä½¿). The last had artwork by Shukoko Yamamoto based on her artwork of Cat Angels.

A Samurai push-your-luck, set collection game for 2-6 players. Take to the Dojo and Roll dice, allocating them to the available Virtues. Learn enough Virtues of the Bushido Code to impress one of the Daimyo in order to win!

For twelve years the Province of Tosa has been blessed with peace and prosperity. Peace and prosperity that has been won through valiant battle and sacrifice that has left Tosa with little army yet still what remains defends the earned prosperity. Until sea faring invades lay siege to Kochi, a capital port for Tosa and threatens this lasting peace. With the invaders not willing to negotiate; the Shogun orders his many Daimyo to travel Tosa in search for recruits to train in order to bolster the dwindling ranks of Samurai for the inevitable military confrontation. 

Bushido, The Card Game is an interesting blend of push your luck and strategy. Each roll of the die will leave you with a decision, collect virtues which are needed to win, or activate Daimyo abilities to alter the game in your advantage. Either decision, however small, will ultimately lead to your victory or demise.

Bushido, The Card Game doesn't lack in "take that" gameplay. Many of the Virtue cards dynamically alter the game when collected. Focus tokens can force a player to reroll any die result at any time - and each of the Daimyo have a special ability to help or hinder training!

Compete as samurai potentials to be the first player recruited!

HvÄ›zdokupy: Hra plná hvÄ›zd (Czech for "Star Clusters: A Game Full of Stars") is an abstract logical game for 2 to 6 players. The players of this game become astronomers trying to find a given constellation. The goal is to be the first player to find the given constellation.

The game is played on a shared 10x10 grid board, which represents the night sky. Each player is assigned a unique constellation to look for on the board. During the game, players take turns to place stars on the grid based on dice rolls. The number rolled on the dice shows with how many stars the currently placed star must neighbour. The dice is 8-sided and each number is part of a pair, so the player may choose between 2 different results. The first player to find/construct their given constellation among the stars wins the game. Shared victories are possible.

A remarkable feature of the game is that the major game pieces glow in the dark, making the game suitable for playing at night, which contributes to its theme.

item.description:
A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away Clone Wars raged. Stand on the path of light or dark side of the Force and turn the tide of the war. Each player can choose one of four characters: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Anakin Skywalker, Count Dooku and Asajj Ventress. Each character has their own abilities and the ability to wield power. Moving on the playing field - circuit galaxy - players will perform the tasks of their allies, and fight each other for influence over the planets and military bases. With the game cards and dice the player can influence the other characters enter the battlefield and more troops to crush the enemy's defenses.

name.value: Irresponsibility: The Mr Toast Card Game

item.description: Irresponsibility (The Mr Toast Game) is a family friendly card game for 2-4 players. Players take turns either helping Mr Toast be irresponsible by playing fun Green Recreation cards or by saddling your opponents with Red Responsibility cards to keep Mr Toast from having fun. Mr Toast's friends also get in on the action as Buddy cards who add to the score of the Green Recreation cards! You also get to play Gray Action cards which can let you draw more cards, play extra cards or even take over another players position. Lastly are the Yellow No Way cards which stop the effects of the Gray Action cards. The winner is the first person to get to 15 points worth of Recreation & Buddy cards!

item.description:
"So Goes The Hare" - Sometimes referred to as "There Goes The Hare"

Two to four rabbits (each represented by a different color marble) are hunting in a field trying to capture Carrots, Lettuce and Dandelions. Carrots are worth 3 points (Orange Marbles), Lettuce 2 points (Green Marbles) and Dandelions are worth 1 point (Yellow Marbles). The rabbits come in their own unique colors. Rabbits jump like a Knight in Chess and must land on an occupied field, and win the item there. When no more mores can be made, the game ends and the points are totaled. High score wins. Although you can also win by being the last rabbit standing.

As riders for the Pony Express, you'll risk life and limb to make a buck in the old west.

Spend 3 weeks in the saddle, claiming parcels and planning your route from Missouri to California and back. Make your deliveries and pick up helpful items along the way.

Riders of the Pony Express uses a unique and tense "count-up" auction to claim parcels every round, and then hazard tiles can spice up the roues between towns, forcing players to stay flexible with their plans.

The rider with the most cash at the end of the game wins!

The ancient Greeks from Phocaea urgently want to expand their domains. They are sailing for the Iberian peninsula to establish a permanent trading spot. In a tiny island close to the northern east coast, the newcomers will found Emporion, the first great Greek settlement on the peninsula. From there, they will try to increase their fame and fortune by commanding expeditions, trading valuable goods with Athens, competing to win the favor of Gods, and promoting the Hellenistic culture throughout the Iberian lands.

In more detail, in Emporion, players buy cards and place them in their play areas. These cards help players to improve their armies, build spectacular and diverse constructions, trade goods, explore new lands, and perform cultural events.

•••

¡Las polis griegas quieren expandirse! Para ello surcan los mares rumbo a la península Ibérica, en busca de tierras fértiles. Fundarán Emporion, la primera gran polis griega en la península, y las familias aristócratas buscarán ganar prestigio comandando expediciones, comerciando con Atenas, ganando el favor de los dioses y expandiendo la cultura helenística por las tierras íberas.

Objetivo
El objetivo es lograr cartas que otorguen puntos de Prestigio, usando el comercio, la cultura o la guerra. Cuando un jugador coloca la decimoquinta carta en su dominio, o se agota el mazo, o se agotan las cartas de Prestigio, termina la ronda y se determina el vencedor contando los puntos de Prestigio que cada jugador tenga.

item.description:
Auction Heads nos pone en la piel de los subastadores de almacenes abandonados en Estados Unidos, al estilo de los populares programas de TV donde los participantes de la subasta de un almacén realizan pujas por quedarse con su contenido, del que solo pueden ver una pequeña parte, no pudiendo ver la parte de atrás del almacén ni tocar nada del contenido. De esta manera el que realice la puja más alta se quedará con todo el lote, que podrá darle beneficios o pérdidas dependiendo de su valor real.

ENGLISH



Auction Heads is a game of abandoned storage auctioneers, bidding on and winning the most bizarre objects, appraising the items found within, and selling the most lucrative and interesting pieces to gain the game. The player who make the highest bid will remain with the entire batch, and after the deck ends, the player with the most money wins. But, be carefully! There may be hidden illegal objects that can make you lose money!

item.description: A twist on the usual trivia games; players ask questions personal to themselves.

Finding Wally is never child's play but it's even trickier when there's a board made up of four movable sections and a ticking timer to battle against! If you know a fan of the red and white jumper-wearing character, then they'll love the chance to show their stripes in this exciting fast and furious search and find game where they'll say goodbye to school holiday boredom and so long to rainy day blues. Great for girls and boys alike aged seven upwards (and fun-loving grown-ups too!), the Where's Wally? Board Game is a race against time where being eagle-eyed and speedy is a winning combination! Players must find the picture on the board which matches the picture on their card. It might sound simple but try doing that when the sections of the board have been rearranged and there's a constant tick telling you that time is running out. The aim of the game is to be the fastest player to find and cover Where's Wally? pictures on the board with a Wally token. The next player tries to do the same and so the game continues until the timer stops. A card with a number '2' on it means double the challenge - you have to match the picture on your card to the picture on the board twice before play moves on. And if you collect a card with an 'R' on it, the direction of play is reversed and the four sections of the Where's Wally? board must be rearranged too. Simply super stripy fun for Where's Wally? fans who like a challenge!

name.value: ヘッジホッグジレンマ (Hedgehog's Dilemma)

item.description:
In ãƒ˜ãƒƒã‚¸ãƒ›ãƒƒã‚°ã‚¸ãƒ¬ãƒ³ãƒž (Hedgehog's Dilemma), you and your fellow players are hedgehog breeders who are trying to encourage the little critters to get closer to one another on a cold day, perhaps to form a hedgehog couple if all goes well, so they need to be close enough to meet but not too close.

User summary:
The deck has cards numbered 1 to 4. Players are dealt six cards to their hand and a number of cards are laid face-up matching the number of players. Everyone chooses a card from their hand and reveals it. Cards that match up go to the player, everything else is discarded. Repeat this until the players' hands are empty, then score. Total up the whole of the cards you collected, the player with the highest total wins a token. Shuffle the whole deck over, play another round. The game ends when the fifth token is given out, the most tokens wins.

Matching cards simply means matching the number on the card, so if the table shows 1,3,3,4 and you're the only one to lay a 4, you get both 4s. But if more than one player lays a 4, you all get nothing. If two players each laid a 3, they'd each get a 3 from the table. If one player laid a 3, they'd only get one 3.

But if a 1 is matched in a turn, then the highest value table card is discarded, and so any matches are also lost. This brings in double-think, what are they other players likely to do? Do you go for the 4, or try a safer 3? What looks like a simple game becomes more cunning and watching what cards have already been played matters.

The card art is lovely, showing a variety of spiny creatures, sea urchins, lizards, turtles, porcupines. The cards are quite thin but the game is well made.

item.description:
Each player tries to find and assign the fruits in the correct order.
When it's your turn, you first try to find an apple in the hidden tokens. For this, you return one of the chips that are on the table.
If you have returned an apple, you can give it as food to the caterpillar. On your next turn, you will seek a pear, then a plum, and so on.
Continue in this way to find, little by little, the food for the caterpillar in the right order.
The first player who have returned all six cards wins the game.

An apple, two pears, three plums? In the cards you see different images of fruits and with different amounts of numbers.
Mix all the cards and then You must try to correctly match the cards together.
The winner is the player with most matched cards.

item.description:
"I know 3.029e+30 ways to drive you crazy."

Dive into the tumult and test yourself against the game and your friends in this frantic rush to prevent the disintegration of an otherwise nice and comely family. (Yeah, right...)

Tumult is a speed-puzzler that utilizes a random puzzle-generator mechanism to reach as many as 3.029e+30 different puzzles. All players solve the same puzzle simultaneously and compare results when time has run out. Every mistake causes tears, and whoever has caused the fewest tears at the end of a certain number of rounds wins.

Tumult reimplements Uluru/Pelican Cove, with some notable differences in the card set and gameplay. The physical and thematic design is also new; one particular improvement is that Tumult is playable even if you are colorblind!

ã¦ã¥ã¾å¸« (Tezuma Master) is a trick-taking game themed on "tezuma", or traditional Japanese magic/sleight of hand such as making a butterfly made of paper fly through the air. Each player secretly chooses one of three scoring cards for themself at the start of the round, and that determines how they'll score for the cards that they've taken. Each player also has a few special power cards that they can use when desired, and each of the four suits has a single trump card.

In ã‚ã‚„ã‹ã—è‰å­ (Ayakashi Soushi), players want to get rid of the tiles in hand quicker than anyone else. Tiles are hexagonal with a figure in the middle, and they feature borders of either a single unique color or two colors split evenly around the tile.

On a turn, a player places a tile on the board, triggering the special effect of the depicted figure if the border of that tile matches an adjacent tile. The tiles with unique colors each have a special power that takes effect when placed.

Ninja Ninja Ninja features a 54-card deck, with cards numbered 0-5 in three colors, with each card appearing three times.

Players have a hand of seven cards, and they play three at a time to create strong card combinations, such as three cards of the same number and color (strongest), three cards in sequence, etc. As they reveal combinations, they can cause damage to one another based on the strength of their attacks and defenses.

In this game for children, you need to move pawns into the holes with the corresponding shapes and earn the most victory tokens this way.
 Contents:
 1 gameboard
 12 pawns (in 4 different color red, green, blue,yellow, and 3 different shape triangle, brick, roll in every color)
 12 victory tokens
 4 color tokens (in 4 different colors)
 3 shape tokens
 2 dice
 When it's your turn, you need to take a step with a pawn. The goal is moving a pawn into a field having a hole with the same shape. When this occurs you can get a victory token. To take a step with a pawn, you need to roll with 2 dice. The first die identifies the number of steps, the second die identifies the color, so if you roll green and 2 you have to take 2 steps with one of the green pawns.
 If you roll a star with the color die, you need to select a color token from the face-down pile and a shape token also from the face-down pile and these identify which pawn you must move.
 The game ends when all pawns fell down in the holes.
 The player with the most victory tokens wins the game.

name.value: Nemo's War: 20.000 Meilen unter dem Meer

item.description:
Jules Verne's classic novel Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea tells the story of Captain Nemo and his astounding ship, the Nautilus. The second edition of Nemo's War, Victory Point Games' popular solitaire offering from designer Chris Taylor, is a greatly enhanced offering featuring mass-production printing and amazing Ian O'Toole art and graphics throughout.

Set in year 1870, you set sail in this amazing electric-powered submarine, assuming the role and motive of Captain Nemo as you travel across the seas on missions of science, exploration, anti-Imperialism, and War!

With this supercharged second edition of Nemo's War, prepare yourself for the adventure of a lifetime!

Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale

Solitaire Suitability: 9 on a 9 scale

Scale: Time is measured in Action Points which represent approximately 1 week of real time; each encounter is with 1 major ship (its crew and contents) and each area is 1 Ocean.

item.description:
Now it is possible to respond to the Daedalus challenge at home. Labyrinth game features four challenges where your task is to collect "livspuckar".

The game has 4 stages.

Stage 1. collect "livspuckar" in a labyrint while a robot chasing you.

Stage 2. build a pattern quckest.

Stage 3. jump on pods over a "slime sea"

Stage 4. memory.

on each stage you can collect at most 3 "livspuckar", most in the end wins the game.

Based on a swedish TV-show for children.

item.description:
Marseille Sophistiqué is your guide to one of the most complex families of card games in the world! A 78-card deck, elegantly illustrated and faithful to the sensibility of its 15th century origins, updated with modern gameplay in mind.

The Tarocchi family of games is a historical set of point-trick taking games, played in a series of zero-sum hands. Most in the family include a signature fluctuating team system where one bids for the high-risk, high-reward position of the single opponent to the other players, who form a temporary team for the duration of the hand. Players may additionally bet on a series of secondary goals, to achieve bonus points along with those for the hand itself. A game is played to a variable number of rounds in which each player deals a hand.

Marseille Sophistiqué includes an introductory rulebook, containing historical game rules for
-Baronetti, a simple 2-player introductory rules set that focuses on the basic point-trick principles, also good for fast games and appropriate for children
-Scarto, a 3-player free-for-all
-French Tarot, the classic 4-player, team-based trick taking game, with variants for 3-6 players
-adaptations for 5-suited Poker

Free digital content extends these rules to include
-Droggn, a 3-4 player game with a smaller deck, more forgiving to the opponent.
-Hungarian Tarokk, a 4-5 player game with an advanced bonus system
-Illustrated Hungarian Tarokk, a variant for those who have mastered Hungarian Tarokk
-Rules variants reflecting some of the regional iterations of games

item.description:
Rules light skirmish game for 28mm scale zombie survival scenarios, played with miniatures and terrain on the tabletop using 20 sided dice. Suggested game size is 3-5 human survivors verses 36-150 zombies!

From the rulebook introduction:

ZOMBIES & SURVIVORS is the free downloadable fast play ‘fun’ Zombie game from Grekwood Miniatures. This game guide has all the information required to start playing the zombie apocalypse.

First complete the puzzle about different terrains and animals.
Then take turns to spin the spinner and matching the different animals to the correct categories.
Who has placed the most tiles to the correct categories is the winner.

First complete the large world puzzle with different animals.
Then take turns to spin the spinner and matching the animals and fish to their correct habitats.
Who has matched the most tiles is the winner.

Maiandros is a 2-player connection game (such as Hex, Twixt, etc).

Games are always played in odd square boards with 9x9 being the minimum size recommended.In this game players alternate turns placing identical two-color tiles, each with an inverse side. Tiles must be placed in a way that its colours match the colours printed on the corners of each square (to ensure all tiles match each other). The goal of the game is to connect opposite sides of the board, be it horizontally (east-west) or vertically (north-south).
